one_reviews_text: If your looking to play through the same levels and fight the same enemies over and over buy it, the enemies are just health sponges and the enemies dont change at all other than adding armor. The levels allowed for some floating rocks to just phase through the map and some spots would catch you so you couldnt move for a second or arrows mid air. My last complaint was just archery, if you pulled back a little too far the bow would sling up so your just shooting an arrow into the sky. Was hoping to see better.

Great Game
Servers are a ghost town

review_title: Super fun bring all your friends!
one_reviews_text: I like this game. It is very action packed! Bring your friends and blow up some orks!

Good Game, but where are the uptdates. Why are on Steam the games are better and more up to date.. On Steam this game called Trickster VR: Co-op Dungeon Crawler. Did i miss something ? Edit: you did very well iam happy with the game good work thank you.

Pros:
Good variety of weapon types
Decent graphics, voice acting, and VR implementation
Decent variety of enemy types
Coop is crossplatform and works well

Cons:
Gets repetitive after a few hours, not much real content
Combat isn't satisfying and is very basic
Some terrain issues


This game is fun for a few hours with a friend, but lacks any real depth to make it a game that you'd keep coming back to.  The combat is functional, but extremely basic (just flailing around for melee, no physics or anything like that).  And while there are ~40 stages, they are all really the same.  You pick a "stage" and it just generates a random map with one of maybe 4 objectives.   Tough call between 2 or 3 stars, gave it 3 stars for having crossplatform coop play and a low price.

IMHO - Most VR games are tactile gimmicks, unfinished messes, or provide half-baked story lines, this game is all around well done!

Combat: 5/5 The combat is what you should expect from a medieval-style game.  Shields work well and the magic weapons are a total blast to use!

Story:  3/5 The story is alright, I think the effort into the story matches the pace of the game.  It gives you a reason to why you're there and sets the mood.

Mechanics: 4/5 Game mechanics are overall nice, stometimes getting stuck is a thing but it's relatively easy to get out of being stuck.  The game is basically a 3D version of a 2D side scrolling game which makes it nostalgic and refreshing.

Weapons:  5/5 Awesome variety and well balanced!

Online: 5/5  Everyone, minus a player or two, I have played with is absolutely awesome, and I've probably played with about 25 online players total.

Definitely a must have VR game!!!

review_title: Fun romp with high production value
one_reviews_text: Been playing this game co-op and having a blast!  Good use of touch controls, easy-to-understand game mechanics, and high production value.  Well worth a look!

So this is a coop focused dungeon (open-air really) crawler. Playing solo though is just as fun. Keep in mind, it's mostly just mindless fun. Go to this open air dungeon and kill everything, get loot & upgrades, rinse & repeat. There's really no story. Quests are pretty similar. Dungeons start looking the same. But there's lots of weapons to try and different enemies to kill. Better with friends.

The game looks great with colorful graphics.  Encountered a few bugs where the AI would get stuck but nothing big.  The melee feels very weightless and doesn't really require any skill.  I can't find anyone online to play with though, there's never any games going.   Some of the missions seem too difficult for solo players.

review_title: A lot of fun with a few issues
one_reviews_text: As of right now, the game is a lot of fun but very short. Once you finish all the missions and unlock all the weapons (which can be done in just a few hours), you can either repeat them or play survival mode where you fight wave after wave of orcs. I wish there was a little more variety. Also there seems to be an issue where the game starts to glitch (lag, orcs disappear...) after playing it for 1-2 hours straight. Easily fixed by restarting the game but still slightly annoying.

Bought it about a year ago and i've kept noticing update after update and have kept checking in every few months.  a  lot of dedication has been put into this game and itd be amazing to play the first release of this game to compare it to today's! few games have I seen improve this much  while in early access even.  For the fact that its actually fun to play now and the amount of care shown by those making this game that i'd recommend it today! Started as a 2 out of 5 stars now a 4 out of 5 but in case i forget to change review down the line as it gets even better i'm giving it 5 out of 5 now!
Loving the progression and weapon systems, game is fun to play. Good difficulty curve.

I gave 3 stars but it was closer to 2. 
Swinging wildly with no real feel for what you are doing.
Swarmed instead of being in the fight just swinging wildly to get them off me.
Arrows are fun but not strong enough.
Good luck check back later going to go kill some pirates

I played this one coop with a friend and it left me wishing for better mechanics. I found myself just swinging my sword around wildly, blocking with the shield seemed random/pointless. The world is beautiful, but feels static and dead. The enemy AI is pretty terrible - the update loop is so slow that frequently they walk to where you were standing 30 seconds ago, kinda hilarious but also sad. Having said that, it's not that expensive and it's kinda fun to shoot a bow at mindless mobs and hack them to bits.

not the best VR game but it has his charme. Its nice to kill these Orks in unique ways. But its still need improvement, like a non Coop mode with less enemys, because somtimes there are too much for just 1 player

review_title: Impressive. Short. Needs a game studio.
one_reviews_text:
It's a great game but very limited in content. Multiplayer and the random objectives with random maps help replayability, but the majority of players are people who have less than 10 hours.
It's come a long way in a year from a single developer but it's still very 'alpha' feeling.
Looking forward to trying it out again in a year.

review_title: Cool game; but allways on DRM crap!
one_reviews_text: Its a nice game, and a cool locomotion system(there is various setup to checkout) and fun gameplay.... when its works. But im have seen various "Game Server: Peer Created" now, which im allready tired of it, which is why im hate those allways drm crappy. So dont tell users this game not require a internet connection, which its does and can get the game to halt. Simply not nice!

I would recommend the game without hesitation, cooperative is frankly funny. As suggestions for improvement would add improvements in melee combat.
When you are in front of an orc, he ends up being too close to the player and as they have very short weapons the exchange of strokes and shield stops becomes uncomfortable, and on the other hand, as they are low it is like fighting with a child, me I have to be half crouched because most of his punches go up to my hip and this is also frankly uncomfortable, also they can pass throw me, so i can´t play in the "tank" rol. Making them a little higher, giving them longer weapons, (a good orc combat ax would be very good) and making the collision with the player was a little more distant would be a very good melee. To add something more about it, animations could be improved when melee weapons collide, right now it is sometimes confusing.

And some general points, orcs with axes physically cross the archers when there is little space for them to approach, is rare and sometimes get stuck on the stairs. The crows fly against the branches and also get stuck, fun to see, but also rare.

It's all for now, I will continue to play and enjoy the game.
Keep working hard, you're doing great!

I was excited to try this especially since it was a co-op game and I have most fun when playing WITH my family BUT, the movement mechanics in the game have a long way to go in order to make this game playable for me. I wanted the free movement rather than teleporting but the game locks you into a single direction once you start moving and your turns are in chunky 90 degree increments. Also it puts you into tunnel vision when you start moving forward. All of this makes the combat clunky and unfun. I tried hard to like this game but I couldn't even force myself to finish the first level because the movement mechanics ruined it for me.
review_feedback: Hey McFear. Every single thing you mentioned can be set in the settings. Check it out, the game has every movement option possible.

one_reviews_text:
This isn't a complete finished game and it really does have quite a few issues but it also has absolutely huge potential. Is it worth the money in it's current state? That's a definate YES. The procedural terrain keeps it fresh and keeps me playing again and again. I'm really looking forward to seeing this develop into an amazing title! I hope the dev keeps up the good work and I have no regrets investing in this game. I encourage you to do so also. :)


UPDATE: Most of the issues are fixed and there are regular updates from the developers. It just keeps on getting better! A superb game for the fantasy Orc slayers out there. Addition of Co-op play adds an extra dimension plus lots of cool new spells hidden in treasure chests. This could end up being the WoW for VR.

A great bow and sword game for VR. Fun and frantic gameplay, good art design and a very attentive developer. I love the progression in the game and it's been great fun unlocking each of the weapons and trying to find the ones I don't have.

The 'Twin Sticks' locomotion and the way the 'Teleport' locomotion in implemented in this game are an example of how VR locomotion should be done. If only every developer would add these same locomotion options, we'd have the options to suit everyone and all games would be open to all VR users regardless of their sensor setup. Of all the VR games I own the locomotion options in this are up there with the best of them.


If you enjoy the longbow part of The Lab then you'll love this game, the bow handling is really well done and satisfying, and the crossbows are also really fun. It's one I keep coming back to and it's been getting better with each update. 
Totally recommended from me.
Really nice coop and single player game ! .. if u like dungeon crawler type this one u need to get!
Really fun game, but why the steam version has faster update?
review_feedback: Happy to say the game version is now the same on Oculus Home. We launched co-op first on steam to make sure everything works as it should. From now on, the game is going to be updated on every store at the same time.

one_reviews_text: Sometimes waves of monster dissappear, get stuck in walls or just stand still. I would've honestly liked to be able to "earn" the weapons with points to give the game a goal. Like at 10.000 points you can buy a shield, 20.000 a bow with limited arrows, ect ect. with the double crossbow being the final ultimate weapon. It's just too easy.
review_feedback: Thanks for the feedback! The concept with buying weapons is interesting, but we didn't want to lock out all 13 weapons (and most of the fun!) behind a grind system. We hope to add gold and gems you'll be able to upgrade the weapons with instead. Btw, did you try any Legendary difficulty levels? Dual crossbow is not going to win those by itself.

one_reviews_text: the black circle you get when you move needs to be removed. swinging the word totally sucks as well the hitbox or something needs to be touched up or something.
review_feedback: Hey nightlock! You can turn off the black circle (the vignette) in the settings. We're constantly improving the combat system so be sure to check it out next update!

review_title: Fantastic Game to Show Off VR
one_reviews_text: Love this game.  Dev is friendly and great.  A really good game to showcase the power of VR with the different movement options so you can discover your comfort level.  Graphics are great and addition of quests has made it top notch.

I've been following Trickster for about half a year now, and it's shaping up to be a pretty good VR Action RPG. It's already in a state where it's worth more than the purchase price, and it also keeps getting pretty frequent updates. There are a decent number of VR games in this genre, but this one stands out as both showing great promise for it's future as well as already being in a pretty great place.

If you like slaying orcs and goblins, you will love this game.

In this game you take on quests in different "arenas". There is a great variety of different enemies, each which have its own abilities.  And there is a great progression system in this game, where you get new weapons as you complete different quests.

Also, this game has a lot of different options for locomotion, which other developers could really learn from. It does not matter, if you like teleporting or full locomotion or even a combination of both. This game has it.

The developer updates the game very often and listens to the fans of the game. At this price, it is a steal. Get it!

How hard could it be to have an opening screen that tells you how to do anything? I literally could not figure out how to start the game. Also, I could not find a way to hold both the bow and sword with my right hand which I prefer. The movement system sucks, I wish the teleport option was like The Lab, Robo Recall, Starseed or most other good games. I would like to play this game if I knew how, but I don't have the patience.
review_feedback: Hey christianholmes, thanks for the feedback! We've added a Guardian to the game that guides the player through the world. You can now also choose bow and sword hand separately. The blink teleport system inspired by The Lab and Robo Recall is now available in the settings. Do you think you could give the game another chance? Cheers!

review_title: Made for the fantasy games' fans.
one_reviews_text: If you enjoyed Rec Room's Quest Mode, you'll love this one. It builds upon that idea and brings it to totally new level. Procedural levels that are different every time you play provide a trove of content to beat. Each weapon is a different playstyle in disguise you can mix&match to your liking. Enemies are very interesting to fight, each packing a few special abilities, even though they sometimes use it in a dumb way or get stuck in a tight corridor. I played this game on steam first (devs do give out keys if you bought the game on one of the platforms) - and I have to say it plays even better on oculus home. If you crave fantasy action, this is a great pick.
Combines aspects of Windlands, Zelda, World of Warcraft and Diablo. Very enjoyable especially if you have a 360 setup.

I can see how some people would really like this game, but it just didn't click for me. The game is a steam port and I'm glad to see that he developer took the time and effort to bring this game to Oculus. (The arrow catapults still show Vive controllers.)
Very responsive developer who welcomes feedback and actively develops in reaction to it. Nice mindless replayability when you don't want to think and just want to slash orcs.
movement is ace, weapons are great and of a selection. LOVE IT!
BUT... The sword and shield contact on models is very bad. I have to really try to hit something multiple times.

review_title: Orcs must die meets Diablo in VR.
one_reviews_text: Great fantasy action piece. Enviroments look great, enemies are varied and every item you unlock is a new way to play the game. Looking forward to co-op mode!
review_feedback: Thanks Whocaresifiwin! Hope to see you in co-op in June!

review_title: First game you should get on touch
one_reviews_text:
This is the type of game I dreamed VR fantasy would be. While it does not even pretend to have a narrative story, the amount of fun you get from slashing, shooting and blowing up orcs on the procedurally generated levels simply cannot be compared to any other title out there. 

It sports very ituitive motion options, with 4 modes of teleportation, walk and everything in between. Have to yet see a game that does this better.

There are some quirks with enemy AI making stupid decision like turning away from you and walking off a cliff, but I guess that's to be expected from a thick skulled orc. 

The weapons are fun to explore and try out. Every one is new way of playing the game, from a hunter sharpshooter to dual wielding barbarian, you can pretty much be whoever you want. 

All in all, it punches way above its' price point. Best value for your money you can get.

The game has best value for money ive seen in VR. Been following it on Steam for quite a few months.

It's infinitely replayable thanks to the random levels and new content dropping in almost every week.

Original game world, tight controls and just a very enjoyable experience. Huge thanks to the devs for allowing steam players to transfer to oculus home.

review_title: I keep coming back to this
one_reviews_text: Though it's simple, the gameplay is addicting and aways throws something new at you. The later levels are crazy difficult, feels really satisfying when you finally beat them.
Completely immersive and unique world, full of interseting combat mechanics. Fun as hell.

review_title: Orcs must die meets Diablo in VR.
one_reviews_text: Great fantasy action piece. Enviroments look great, enemies are varied and every item you unlock is a new way to play the game. Looking forward to co-op mode!
review_feedback: Thanks Whocaresifiwin! Hope to see you in co-op in June!
